snippet: A document released to Communist Party cadres enumerated what it called subversive social currents, including Western-inspired notions of human rights, that must be fought.
abstract: Document released to China's Communist Party cadres enumerates what it calls subversive social currents, including Western-inspired notions of human rights, that must be fought; it bears the unmistakable stamp of Xi Jinping, China’s new top leader, and shows that Xi’s confident public face has been accompanied by fears that party is vulnerable.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Ansfield contributed reporting from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: A document released to Communist Party cadres enumerated what it called subversive social currents, including Western-inspired notions of human rights, that must be fought.

headline.main: China Takes Aim at Western Ideas
headline.print_headline: China Takes Aim At Western Ideas
